Class KeyUtil

public final class KeyUtil extends Object
Utility class for cryptographic key operations.

  • Method Details

    • validateAsymmetricKeySize

      public static void validateAsymmetricKeySize(AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, int keySize) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Validates the size of an asymmetric key based on the specified algorithm. Ensures that the key size meets the minimum or required standards for security purposes.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the asymmetric algorithm
      keySize - the size of the key in bits, which will be checked against the requirements specified for the given algorithm. For RSA and DSA, the minimum is 2048 bits. For EC, only specific sizes such as 256 (P-256), 384 (P-384), or 521 (P-521) bits are allowed. If the key size does not satisfy the constraints for the selected algorithm, an exception will be thrown.
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key size does not satisfy the constraints for the selected algorithm

    • deriveSecretKey

      public static SecretKey deriveSecretKey(char[] passphrase, byte[] salt, int iterations, int keyBits, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Derive a SecretKey from a passphrase using PBKDF2-SHA256.

      Make sure to store the salt to be able to retrieve the generated key again later.

      This method provides a type-safe alternative to deriveKey(char[], byte[], int, int, InputBufferHandling) that returns a SecretKey object instead of raw bytes.

      Parameters:
      passphrase - the passphrase (cleared after use)
      salt - random salt (minimum 16 bytes)
      iterations - iteration count (minimum 10000)
      keyBits - key size in bits (128, 192, or 256)
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      derived SecretKey for symmetric encryption
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key derivation fails

    • deriveSecretKey

      public static SecretKey deriveSecretKey(char[] passphrase, char[] context, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Derive a SecretKey using a context-based salt. The context should be unique and stable for the intended use case.

      Security Note: While more secure than a fixed salt, this approach still produces deterministic results. For maximum security in multi-user systems, consider using deriveSecretKey(char[], byte[], int, int, InputBufferHandling) with a unique random salt per user/session and store the salt securely.

      Example usage:

      
 char[] password = "mySecretPassword".toCharArray();
 SecretKey key = KeyUtil.deriveSecretKey(password, "user:john.doe");
 String encrypted = SymmetricCryptUtil.encrypt(key, "sensitive data");
      Parameters:
      passphrase - the passphrase (cleared after use)
      context - unique context (e.g., "user:john", "file:/path/to/file", "section:config")
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      derived SecretKey for symmetric encryption
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key derivation fails

    • generateSalt

      public static byte[] generateSalt(int length)
      Generate random salt for key derivation.
      Parameters:
      length - salt length in bytes (recommended: 16 or 32)
      Returns:
      random salt

    • validateSymmetricKey

      public static void validateSymmetricKey(Key key, SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Validates a symmetric key for use with the specified algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to validate
      algorithm - the algorithm the key will be used with
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if the key is not compatible or key validation fails

    • toSecretKey

      public static SecretKey toSecretKey(byte[] keyBytes) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Create a SecretKey from a byte array using the default algorithm.
      Parameters:
      keyBytes - the key bytes (must be 128, 192, or 256 bits for AES)
      Returns:
      SecretKey instance
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the bytes could not be converted to a secret key

    • toSecretKey

      public static SecretKey toSecretKey(byte[] keyBytes, SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Converts the provided byte array into a SecretKey using the specified symmetric algorithm.
      Parameters:
      keyBytes - the byte array representing the key material
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm used to validate the key size and determine the key algorithm
      Returns:
      a SecretKey generated from the provided key material and algorithm
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key size is invalid for the specified algorithm

      the generated SecretKey
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation fails

      Returns:
      the generated key pair
      Throws:

    • generateECKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateECKeyPair(String curveName) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Generate an Elliptic Curve key pair using a named curve.

      Supported standard curves:

      • "secp256r1" (P-256) - 256-bit curve
      • "secp384r1" (P-384) - 384-bit curve
      • "secp521r1" (P-521) - 521-bit curve
      Parameters:
      curveName - the name of the elliptic curve ("secp256r1", "secp384r1", "secp521r1")
      Returns:
      the generated EC key pair
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation fails or the curve is not supported

    • generateRSAKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateRSAKeyPair() throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Generate an RSA key pair with default key size (2048 bits).
      Returns:
      the generated RSA key pair
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key generation fails
